info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 2:37PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Warren and central Washington Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 235 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bolton Landing, or 8 miles northeast of Lake George Village, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds of around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Whitehall, Lake George Village, Granville, Comstock, Bolton Landing, Mount Hope, Bolton, Hampton, Lake George, Fort Ann, Shelving Rock, South Bay, Cleverdale, Middle Granville, Low Hampton, North Granville, South Bay Village, South Granville, Truthville and Raceville. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Rainfall rates of up to 1 inch per hour is possible.
